      • getCurrentMethodName

        public static String getCurrentMethodName(Integer depth)
        Gets the name of the current method (with the selected depth) being executed.
        Parameters:
        depth - Depth in the current stack for the desired method (0 is the first and so on).
        Returns:
        The name of the current method (with the selected depth) being executed.

      • getFieldName

        public static String getFieldName(String methodName)
        Gets the field name from a getter/setter.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The method name.
        Returns:
        The field name from a getter/setter. Or null, if the method is not a getter/setter.

      • getFieldName

        public String getFieldName()
        Gets the field name from a getter/setter.
        Returns:
        The field name from a getter/setter. Or null, if the method is not a getter/setter.

      • invokeMethod

        public Object invokeMethod(Object targetObject,
                  Object[] paramsValues,
                  Boolean ignoreAccess)
                    throws org.dejava.component.exception.localized.unchecked.EmptyParameterException,
                           org.dejava.component.exception.localized.unchecked.InvalidParameterException,
                           InvocationException
        Invokes a method from an object/class.
        Parameters:
        targetObject - The target object from which the method will be invoked.
        paramsValues - Parameters values to be used during the invocation.
        ignoreAccess - If the defined access for the method must be ignored.
        Returns:
        Returns the object returned from the method being invoked.
        Throws:
        org.dejava.component.exception.localized.unchecked.EmptyParameterException - If the target object is null and the method is not static.
        org.dejava.component.exception.localized.unchecked.InvalidParameterException - If the given parameters are from the wrong type or if the method is unaccessible.
        InvocationException - If the method throws an exception itself.

      • invokeMethod

        public Object invokeMethod(String jndiPath,
                  Object[] paramsValues,
                  Boolean ignoreAccess)
                    throws org.dejava.component.exception.localized.unchecked.InvalidParameterException,
                           InvocationException
        Invokes a method from a JNDI object.
        Parameters:
        jndiPath - The JNDI path for the object from which the method will be invoked.
        paramsValues - Parameters values to be used during the invocation.
        ignoreAccess - If the defined access for the method must be ignored.
        Returns:
        Returns the object returned from the method being invoked.
        Throws:
        org.dejava.component.exception.localized.unchecked.InvalidParameterException - If the parameters for this method are not valid (empty or method could not be accessed).
        InvocationException - If the method throws an exception itself.
